episodeTitle: CP9 Takes Off Their Masks! Their Shocking True Faces!
episodeTitleJapanese: 仮面を取ったCP9！その驚きの素顔
episodeTitleRomanized: Kamen o Totta Shī-Pī Nain! Sono Odoroki no Sugao
description: The masked CP9 agents reveal their true identities as trusted members of Water 7's Galley-La Company. Robin confronts Iceburg about the ancient weapon Pluton while Luffy and the crew discover that Lucci, Kaku, Kalifa, and Blueno have been government spies all along. The blueprints Paulie carries are revealed to be fakes as CP9 demonstrates their superhuman Rokushiki techniques.

events.title: Iceburg Confronts Robin About Poneglyphs
events.description: Inside his room, Iceburg confronts Nico Robin about her ability to read the ancient Poneglyphs. He reveals that the World Government made research on Poneglyphs illegal and knows about Robin's unique ability to decipher them. He explains this is why Robin had such a high bounty even at age 8.
events.significance: This moment establishes the central conflict around Robin's dangerous knowledge and foreshadows the World Government's pursuit of her. It connects Robin's past tragedy to the current Water 7 crisis and reveals why she is considered such a threat.

quotes.text: The World Government has made it illegal to continue research on the Poneglyphs. And they know that you can decipher them.
quotes.speaker: Iceburg
quotes.context: Iceburg explaining to Robin why she has been wanted since childhood

events.title: Iceburg Reveals He Has Pluton Blueprints
events.description: Iceburg shockingly reveals to Robin that he possesses the blueprints for Pluton, one of the three Ancient Weapons. This revelation explains why CP9 has targeted him and connects the assassination attempts to the World Government's search for the legendary warship.
events.significance: A major world-building reveal that introduces Pluton as a key element in the story and explains the true motivation behind the attack on Iceburg. This is one of the most important lore drops in the Water 7 arc, connecting to the series' ancient history and the Void Century.

quotes.text: I have the blueprints for the ancient weapon known as Pluton.
quotes.speaker: Iceburg
quotes.context: Iceburg's shocking revelation to Robin about possessing the Pluton blueprints

events.title: Iceburg Sets a Trap
events.description: After revealing information about Pluton to Robin, Iceburg declares that this was all part of a trap he set. He attempts to expose the true attackers by using himself and the blueprints as bait.
events.significance: Shows Iceburg's strategic thinking and willingness to risk his life to protect the Pluton blueprints. This moment demonstrates his cunning and his commitment to keeping the ancient weapon from falling into the wrong hands.

quotes.text: You have fallen for my trap.
quotes.speaker: Iceburg
quotes.context: Iceburg revealing his plan to expose the attackers

events.title: Paulie Reveals Fake Blueprints
events.description: After being severely wounded and falling to the ground, Paulie drops the blueprints he was carrying. When a masked CP9 agent picks them up, Paulie reveals with satisfaction that they are fakes, not the real Pluton blueprints.
events.significance: Demonstrates that Iceburg and the Galley-La foremen were prepared for the CP9 attack and had taken precautions. This moment shows Paulie's loyalty and the depth of planning that went into protecting the real blueprints.

quotes.speaker: Paulie
quotes.context: Paulie revealing the blueprints he was carrying were decoys

events.title: Blueno Demonstrates Tekkai
events.description: When Tilestone charges at the bear-masked agent with his massive mallet in a rage, the masked figure uses Tekkai to harden his body completely, blocking the attack effortlessly. The agent then grabs Tilestone's arm and delivers a devastating punch that knocks him unconscious.
events.significance: First demonstration of the Rokushiki technique Tekkai in the anime, establishing the superhuman abilities of CP9 agents. This moment showcases the overwhelming power difference between the CP9 agents and the Galley-La foremen, foreshadowing the challenges the Straw Hats will face.

events.title: Blueno Uses Soru
events.description: The bear-masked agent (Blueno) demonstrates the Rokushiki technique Soru, moving at incredible speed that appears almost like teleportation to normal observers. This allows him to evade attacks and strike from unexpected angles.
events.significance: Introduction of Soru, one of the six Rokushiki techniques, further establishing CP9's superhuman capabilities. This technique becomes a signature ability used throughout the Water 7 and Enies Lobby arcs.

events.title: Rob Lucci's True Identity Revealed
events.description: The bull-masked agent removes his mask, revealing himself to be Rob Lucci, the quiet shipwright and foreman at Galley-La Company. His revelation shocks Iceburg, who had trusted Lucci as one of his most skilled workers for five years. Lucci's pigeon Hattori sits calmly on his shoulder.
events.significance: One of the most shocking reveals in One Piece, exposing that a trusted ally was actually the leader of a dangerous government assassination squad. This betrayal becomes a pivotal moment in the Water 7 arc and establishes Lucci as a major antagonist. The reveal that someone the crew and characters trusted was an enemy all along adds tremendous emotional weight.

events.title: Kaku's True Identity Revealed
events.description: The skull-masked agent removes his mask to reveal himself as Kaku, the energetic square-nosed shipwright who had inspected the Going Merry and befriended the Straw Hats. His cheerful demeanor is replaced with a serious, professional expression.
events.significance: Another devastating betrayal as Kaku, who had seemed like a friendly ally to the Straw Hats and a trusted member of Galley-La, is revealed to be a CP9 agent. This adds to the emotional impact of the CP9 reveal, showing that multiple trusted figures were enemy spies.

events.title: Kalifa's True Identity Revealed
events.description: The soldier-masked agent removes her mask to reveal herself as Kalifa, Iceburg's beautiful and efficient secretary. Her cold, professional demeanor contrasts sharply with her previous friendly secretary persona.
events.significance: The revelation that even Iceburg's personal secretary was a CP9 spy demonstrates the thoroughness of the World Government's infiltration. Kalifa's betrayal is particularly shocking as she had the closest access to Iceburg and had gained his complete trust over five years.

events.title: Blueno's True Identity Revealed
events.description: The bear-masked agent removes his mask to reveal himself as Blueno, the quiet bartender from the Blueno's Bar in Water 7. He had been observing and gathering information while running his establishment.
events.significance: Completes the reveal of the four primary CP9 agents who had infiltrated Water 7. Blueno's cover as a bartender allowed him to gather intelligence from customers while maintaining a low profile. His reveal shows the extent of CP9's five-year infiltration operation.

events.title: Iceburg's Shock at the Betrayal
events.description: Iceburg is devastated as he sees four of his most trusted colleagues - people he had worked with for five years - revealed as government assassins. His expression shows the profound betrayal he feels, especially regarding Lucci and Kalifa who were closest to him.
events.significance: This moment captures the emotional weight of the CP9 reveal, showing how deeply the betrayal cuts. Iceburg's shock represents the audience's feelings as well, as these characters had been presented as allies for many episodes. The five-year infiltration makes the betrayal especially painful.

events.title: Luffy Gets Stuck Between Buildings
events.description: In a comedic moment amidst the tension, Luffy attempts to reach Iceburg's mansion by stretching between buildings but gets stuck. He struggles comically while his crewmates and the situation escalate around him.
events.significance: Provides brief comic relief during an otherwise intense and dramatic episode. This moment is characteristic of Luffy's impulsive nature and adds levity before the full scope of the CP9 threat becomes clear.

events.title: Straw Hats Confront Galley-La Shipwrights
events.description: The Straw Hat crew members reach the back garden of Iceburg's mansion where they are forced to fight against the Galley-La shipwrights who still believe the Straw Hats are responsible for the attack on Iceburg. The crew must defend themselves while trying to explain the truth.
events.significance: Escalates the conflict and creates a chaotic situation where the Straw Hats must fight people who should be their allies. This battle occurs while the true enemies (CP9) are revealed inside the mansion, creating dramatic irony.

events.title: Kaku Demonstrates Rankyaku
events.description: Kaku demonstrates the Rokushiki technique Rankyaku by kicking with tremendous speed and strength, creating a sharp compressed air blade that can slice through objects. This showcases another of CP9's superhuman abilities.
events.significance: Introduction of Rankyaku, another Rokushiki technique, further establishing the diverse arsenal of abilities CP9 possesses. This technique becomes one of Kaku's signature moves and demonstrates the variety of combat styles within the six powers.

events.title: CP9 Demands the Real Pluton Blueprints
events.description: After revealing their true identities, the CP9 agents demand that Iceburg hand over the genuine Pluton blueprints. They make it clear that their five-year infiltration mission was solely to obtain these blueprints for the World Government.
events.significance: Establishes the central conflict of the Water 7/Enies Lobby saga. The Pluton blueprints become the MacGuffin that drives the plot forward and explains the World Government's ruthless pursuit. This moment clarifies CP9's mission and sets up the subsequent chase and battles.

quotes.text: The World Government has made it illegal to continue research on the Poneglyphs. And they know that you can decipher them.
quotes.speaker: Iceburg
quotes.context: Explaining to Robin why she has been wanted since childhood

quotes.text: I have the blueprints for the ancient weapon known as Pluton.
quotes.speaker: Iceburg
quotes.context: Revealing his possession of the Pluton blueprints to Robin

quotes.text: You have fallen for my trap.
quotes.speaker: Iceburg
quotes.context: Revealing his plan to expose the attackers

quotes.speaker: Paulie
quotes.context: Revealing the blueprints he was carrying were decoys

themes.description: The episode's central theme revolves around the devastating betrayal of trusted allies. Lucci, Kaku, Kalifa, and Blueno spent five years building relationships and trust with the people of Water 7, only to reveal themselves as government assassins. This explores how deep infiltration can weaponize trust.
themes.symbolism: The removal of masks symbolizes the shedding of false identities and the exposure of hidden truths. The masks represent the deception that has persisted for five years, and their removal marks the end of the charade.

themes.description: The introduction of Rokushiki techniques demonstrates that there are levels of power beyond Devil Fruits and normal combat skills. CP9's abilities represent the pinnacle of human physical achievement through rigorous training, contrasting with Devil Fruit powers.
themes.symbolism: The Rokushiki techniques symbolize the World Government's investment in creating superhuman soldiers through discipline and training rather than relying on chance Devil Fruit consumption.
culturalReferences: Rokushiki draws inspiration from martial arts philosophy and the concept of pushing human physical limits through dedicated training, similar to concepts in various Asian martial arts traditions.

themes.description: The episode delves into the dangerous nature of ancient knowledge with the Pluton blueprints and Robin's ability to read Poneglyphs. This knowledge is so dangerous that the World Government will commit atrocities to control it.
themes.symbolism: The Pluton blueprints represent dangerous knowledge from the past that could change the world's power balance. They symbolize the burden of knowing things that could destroy civilizations.
culturalReferences: The concept of forbidden knowledge echoes themes from various mythologies and literature, such as Pandora's Box or the Tree of Knowledge.

themes.description: CP9's five-year mission demonstrates the World Government's patience and dedication to obtaining the Pluton blueprints. This theme explores how far organizations will go and how long they will wait to achieve their objectives.
themes.symbolism: The five-year infiltration represents the idea that some goals require years of patient work and sacrifice of personal identity. The agents lived as different people for half a decade.

characterSpotlights.role: Victim of betrayal and keeper of secrets
characterSpotlights.development: Iceburg is revealed as the keeper of the Pluton blueprints and someone willing to set himself up as bait to expose his attackers. His shock at seeing his trusted colleagues revealed as CP9 agents shows the emotional toll of the betrayal.
keyActions: Confronts Robin about Poneglyphs
Reveals he has the Pluton blueprints
Declares he set a trap for the attackers
Experiences the shock of seeing Lucci, Kaku, Kalifa, and Blueno unmask
quotes: The World Government has made it illegal to continue research on the Poneglyphs. And they know that you can decipher them.
I have the blueprints for the ancient weapon known as Pluton.
You have fallen for my trap.

characterSpotlights.development: Rob Lucci transforms from a quiet, trusted shipwright into the revealed leader of CP9's Water 7 infiltration team. His unmasking is the most shocking of the reveals as he was the most trusted and skilled of the Galley-La foremen.
keyActions: Removes his mask to reveal his true identity
Demands the real Pluton blueprints from Iceburg
Demonstrates his authority as CP9 leader

characterSpotlights.development: Kaku's reveal is particularly impactful because he had befriended the Straw Hats and inspected the Going Merry. His transformation from cheerful shipwright to serious government agent shows his acting skills and dedication to his mission.
keyActions: Removes his mask to reveal his identity
Demonstrates Rankyaku technique
Stands with CP9 against Iceburg

characterSpotlights.development: Kalifa's unmasking reveals that even Iceburg's closest confidant was a spy. Her position as his secretary gave her the most access to information and the best opportunity to steal the blueprints.
keyActions: Removes her mask to reveal her identity
Confronts Iceburg as a CP9 agent

characterSpotlights.development: Blueno demonstrates the power of CP9 by using Tekkai and Soru to effortlessly defeat Tilestone. His reveal as the bartender shows how CP9 infiltrated different levels of Water 7 society.
keyActions: Uses Tekkai to block Tilestone's attack
Defeats Tilestone with overwhelming force
Demonstrates Soru technique
Removes his mask to reveal his identity

characterSpotlights.development: Robin's conversation with Iceburg reveals why she has been hunted since childhood and connects her ability to read Poneglyphs to the current crisis. Her dangerous knowledge makes her a target.
keyActions: Confronts Iceburg about the situation
Learns Iceburg has the Pluton blueprints
Witnesses the CP9 reveal

characterSpotlights.development: Despite being severely wounded, Paulie shows his loyalty to Iceburg by protecting the fake blueprints and revealing they are decoys to frustrate the CP9 agents.
keyActions: Gets wounded protecting the fake blueprints
Reveals the blueprints are fakes
Shows loyalty to Iceburg despite the danger

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy's determination to reach Robin and confront the masked agents is hampered by getting stuck between buildings, providing brief comic relief while highlighting his single-minded determination.
keyActions: Gets stuck between buildings while trying to reach the mansion
Demands the masked agents return Robin

mangaDifferences.difference: The episode adapts manga chapters 343-345, covering the CP9 identity reveal sequence. The pacing is slightly slower in the anime with extended reaction shots to emphasize the shocking nature of the reveals.
The anime adds extended scenes of Luffy stuck between buildings for comedic effect, which is briefer in the manga.

trivia.fact: Episode 243 aired on September 4, 2005, in Japan and received a 10.2% TV rating, indicating strong viewership for this pivotal episode.

This episode marks the first appearance of Rokushiki techniques in the anime, including Tekkai, Soru, and Rankyaku, which become signature abilities of CP9 throughout the Water 7 and Enies Lobby arcs.

The CP9 reveal in this episode is considered one of the most shocking plot twists in One Piece. The fact that the agents used their real names during their five-year undercover mission has become a topic of fan discussion, especially since Rob Lucci's name was already infamous in the One Piece world for killing 500 soldiers at age 13.

sources.title: In retrospect, this thing about Cp9 at Water Seven is kinda insane - Worstgen Forum

trivia.fact: Eiichiro Oda once revealed that Rob Lucci was not originally planned to be part of CP9 during the early development of the Water 7 Saga, suggesting he may have been intended to be just a regular shipwright before the story evolved.

The episode's English title 'CP9 Takes Off Their Masks! Their Shocking True Faces!' directly describes the episode's climactic moments, making it one of the more literally descriptive episode titles in the series.

This episode marks the beginning of Iceburg being portrayed more sympathetically, as viewers learn he has been protecting the Pluton blueprints and was the victim of the assassination attempt, not the perpetrator of any crime against Robin.
